wiki.content: “Feliz Navidad“ is a song written by Puerto Rican singer-songwriter and musician José Feliciano. It was released in 1970 on the long-play José Feliciano, an album that would be renamed in 2022 by BMG as Feliz Navidad. With its simple and heartfelt lyrics, the traditional Spanish Christmas/New Year greeting "Feliz Navidad, próspero año y felicidad" (Feliz Navidad, prospero año y felicidad) followed by the English text "I wanna wish you a Merry Christmas from the bottom of my heart" has become a Christmas classic and has gained popularity around the world. The song has entered the Billboard Hot 100 several times. According to ABC in 2017, it reached the twelfth position but has entered several times since its release in 1970. On January 2, 2021, it reached #2 on the Billboard Hot 100. By Christmas 2022, the original 1970 song had clocked up just over 497 million streams on Spotify. In 1970, in the middle of the production of the album José Feliciano, which was later renamed Feliz Navidad. The album, similar to others published by artists of that time, had a difference. It had songs in Spanish and instrumental songs. His producer, Rick Jarrad proposed him to write a Christmas carol for the occasion​: “We would have to do an original Christmas carol, would you be up for writing one?” The proposal took him by surprise. “I told him I had never done it before, but I was going to try,” he told Billboard. “I thought it would be very difficult to compete with 'White Christmas' and 'Rockin' Around the Christmas Tree.'” - José Feliciano to Billboard Magazine Read more on Last.fm.
